applicant: Barry Thorson DBA: Certified Professional
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct an 11-storey (12 levels) mixed-use, high-rise building with a Social Service Centre on L1 to L4 and 103 social housing residential rental suites on L5 to L11 with 1 level of an underground parkade.
The Level 12 contains mechanical room, covered amenity space, and a storage room. This area has been decided not to be considered as a storey based on discussion between Kevin Lau and Barry Thorson.
The building is designed do meet all requirements of VBBL Section 3.8, and 20% of the residential units are designed to meet the CMHC Universal Accessible Suite Requirements.
STAGE I - EXCAVATION & SHORING
ISSUED: December 19, 2022
STAGE II - FULL PERMIT
ISSUED: June 13, 2023
NOTE: Class-1 Cooking Operation.
NOTE: The Stage II issuance is conditional on receiving documentation to transfer the responsibility for Mechanical Field Review and design changes during construction to another professional.
NOTE: This project was reviewed under the VBBL 2019.
13-Oct-2023 - Revision#1 issued
Change of Mech RPR effective May 5th, 2023. Letters and a new Schedule B on file.
Change of Electrical RPR effective Oct 6th, 2023. Letters and a new Schedule B on file.

applicant: Kathy Henry DBA: K. Henry Design Inc.
description:
High Density Housing / Commercial - New Building - *********************PART 5 DESIGN*********************
To construct a 3-storey Infill Multiple Dwelling residential building containing three dwelling units with an attached 3-car garage (Building 1), having vehicular access from Mackenzie street.
- See BP-2022-00256 for Building 2 at the rear.
******THIS PERMIT HAS BEEN REVIEWED AND ISSUED UNDER THE REQUIREMENTS OF VBBL 2019 AND AMENDMENT EFFECTIVE JUNE 1ST, 2021.***********
Building Review Branch Notes:
1. Sch. A, D, Arch. B, D, Elec. B, Mech. & Plumb. B, Geo. B, Struct. B are submitted.
2. Entire building is sprinklered to NFPA 13R requirements.
3. All dwelling units have separate exterior entrances.
4. Lagan case file was created on Dec 24th, 2021. Comply to VBBL 2019 amendment effective on June 1st, 2021.
5. All new windows, doors, and skylights shall conform to AAMA/WDMA/CSA101/I.S.2/A440, NAFS.

applicant: Michael Van Blokland DBA: LMDG Building Code Consultant
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 29-storey (27-storey Z&D) multi-dwelling secured market rental housing units with 6 level podium and 2 levels of below grade parking. Parking ramp access from lane will be shared with adjacent building at 8460 Ash St and through parkade opening at Level P1. The building is connected to 8460 Ash St at the property line and is separated by 2 h party wall firewall per 3.1.10. Party wall firewall begins at the lowest parking level and terminates at the shared exterior terraces at Levels 2 and 7. First storey at Basement level. Level 28 (29th storey) contains outdoor amenity spaces, garden shed and mechanical rooms.
Fire department response point at Level 1 principal entrance facing Ash St.
Total dwelling units = 252.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued November 24, 2022
Stage 2 - Foundation to Grade - issued April 19, 2023
Stage 3 - Full Construction - issued September 12, 2023

applicant: Alexander Gannochka DBA: ADEPT Engineering Ltd.
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - This permit has been issued for all site work and below grade facilities including two levels of common parking for the proposed development:
To construct a 3-storey Multiple Dwelling consisting of three Buildings:
a 3-storey Multiple Dwelling (North Building) containing six dwelling units,
a 3-storey Multiple Dwelling (West Building) containing six dwelling units, and
a 3-storey Multiple Dwelling (East Building) containing four 3-storey dwelling units and one 2-storey dwelling,
all over one level of parking having vehicular access from the rear lane.
Storage garage is designed as a separate building (3.2.1.2.). North and East building are designed as one building and connected by exit stair #1.
Total Dwelling units = 17.
Refer to BP-2022-02702 for Building 1 (North Building).
Refer to BP-2022-02703 for Building 2 (West Building).
Refer to BP-2022-02704 for Building 3 (East Building).
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511) with amendments effective March 28, 2022.
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements, as required by 3.2.5.5.(3)(b).
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued November 9, 2022
Revision 1 - Change of Geotechnical Engineer of Record, from Ivan Chu, P.Eng. to Read Fenton, P.Eng., effective January 24, 2023. - issued March 8, 2023
Stage 2 - Foundation to Grade - issued April 25, 2023
Stage 3 - Full Construction - in review
(***new bldg contractor BL req'd)

applicant: Tavis McAuley DBA: McAuley Consulting
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 19-storey non-combustible multiple dwelling building, with 215 secured market rental units (including 45 Affordable MIRHPP units) over 3 levels of underground parking access from lane. Residential amenity spaces on Levels 5 and 19.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
STAGE CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued November 4, 2022
Stage 2 - Full Construction - issued July 6, 2023
Revision 1 - To revise shoring drawings to increase excavation to coordinate footing depth of Phase 2 building to the east to avoid future underpinning. No change to slab elevation on P3. - issued August 4, 2023
Revision 2 - Revised drawings to match M/A DP-2023-00790, scope includes:
1. To relocate service rooms in parking levels to allow new convenience doors to interconnect with adjacent tower on Levels P2 and P1,
2. To relocate vehicular passageway to adjacent tower at Level P1,
3. To revised lobby layout and addition of catwalk for mechanical equipment over parking ramp. - in review

description:
Low Density Housing - New Building - To construct a 2-storey two-family dwelling ($761,332.00) with two secondary suites located in the basement with a detached
accessory building (garage), at the rear providing 2 parking spaces,
having vehicular access from the lane.

#2-2036 E 1st Av - Secondary Suite (north side basement)
BACK UNIT
#1-2038 E 1st Av - One Family Dwelling (south side 1st-3rd floor)
#2-2038 E 1st Av - Secondary Suite (south side basement)

applicant: Lois Mallari DBA: Lois Design Studio
description:
High Density Housing / Commercial - New Building - Building Permit for DP-2017-01132 & DP-2021-00452
To construct a new 3-storey Multiple Dwelling containing 3 dwelling units with an electrical shed and 3 surface parking spaces having vehicular access from the lane.
Note: This is a 2 1/2 storey building pursuant to the Zoning & Development By-law.
Sch A, Arch B, Stru B, Geotech B, & Sch D are submitted.
******THIS PERMIT HAS BEEN ISSUED UNDER THE REQUIREMENTS OF VBBL 2019********
Building Review Branch Notes:
- Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13R. Sprinkler valve room shall be separated by 1h FRR from the rest of the building as per VBBL 9.10.10.3.
- All new windows, doors and skylights shall conform to VBBL 5.9.2.2.
- No roof projections on southeast and northwest sides are permitted without a revision to this BP.
- Trellis must not connected tot the building.
- Metering equipment shall conform to VBBL 10.2.2.9.
- Min 11" run shall be provided at all exterior stairs as per VBBL T.9.8.4.2.
REVISION #1 (Nov 28, 2023): Related to DP-2023-00690
- Added an electrical shed at the rear of the lot between the surface parking and the principal building.
- Relocated garbage/recycling and bike spaces & lockers.

applicant: Michael Van Blokland DBA: LMDG Building Code Consultant
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a six-storey mixed use building, non-combustible construction to 3rd storey slab, combustible construction from 3rd storey and above, consisting
1st and 2nd storeys - with 13 retail spaces (shell only - 3 with mezzanines), and eight 2-storey townhouse dwelling units,

6th storey - amenity room, common roof deck and private roof decks,
all over two levels of underground parking accessible from the rear lane.

Storage garage is constructed with 3.2.1.2. slab and as a separate building.

Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.

applicant: Gordon Richards DBA: Jensen Hughes Consulting
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a new 4 storey residential building consisting of 20 dwelling units, all over a single level of below grade parking having access from W Woodstock Avenue. There are two blocks of buildings on this site (North and South) yet this will be treated as a single building since the lowest floor level of the North building is at the same level of the storage garage, there is only a 1.5 hour separation between the storage garage and the dwelling unit, the concrete podium slab will be constructed as a 2 h fire separation.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2014 Vancouver Building By-law (#10908).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13R requirements.
NOTE: This will be a Staged CP process Permit and the CP is Gordon Richards of Jensen Hughes.
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued September 21, 2022
Stage 2 - Full Construction - issued December 16, 2022
Revision 1 - To match DPMA DP-2023-00186, scope includes:
1) Removed underground parking interconnection to adjacent 146 W Woodstock property at level P1, instead providing single ramp for on-site inbound/outbound access, including the installation of a signal/warning light to direct traffic;
2) Removed pedestrian path between 128 W Woodstock and 146 W Woodstock properties and revised landscaping at grade;
3) Adjusted floor to floor heights, and increased overall height of the 4 storey Apartment building (by approx. 1’-5 1/2” to max 49.36 ft), including correction to previously issued building height calculations;
4) Adjusted interior unit layouts, FSR and excluded storage areas;
5) Changes to exterior elevations, including window locations, and dimensions of architectural fin wall features.
6) Electrical, Mechanical, and Structural drawings have updated to suit updated architectural layouts.
Revision 1 drawings will replace all drawings issued at Stage 2. - issued February 21, 2024

applicant: Petar Dimov DBA: Protection Engineering
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - This permit has been issued for all site work and below grade facilities including two levels of common underground parking for the proposed development:
To construct three Multiple Dwelling Buildings:
- a 6-storey, Multiple Dwelling Building (Building 1 - front/east portion of site) containing 67 dwelling units,
- a 2-storey two dwelling building (Building 2 - back/west portion of site, north side), and
- a 2-storey two dwelling building (Building 3 - back/west portion of site, south side),
all over 2 levels of common underground parking accessed from the lane.
Total Dwelling Units = 71.
Refer to BP-2022-00169 for Building 1 - 6859 Cambie St - firefighting response point.
Refer to BP-2022-00171 for Building 2 - 6829 & 6833 Cambie St
Refer to BP-2022-00172 for Building 3 - 6835 & 6839 Cambie St
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511). Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued September 16, 2022
Stage 2 - Full Construction - issued February 22, 2023
Revision 1 - Change of CP, from P.Eng. W.May to P.Eng. P.Dimov, effective June 1, 2023. - issued November 1, 2023

applicant: Tavis McAuley DBA: McAuley Consulting
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 7-storey (Z&D 5-storey) mixed-use building containing
1st to 5th storeys (L1, L1 mezz, L2, L2 mezz and L3) - Wholesale use (shell only) and parking,
6th to 7th storeys with mezzanine (L4, L5 and L5 mezz) - General office use (shell only),
all over one level of underground parking having vehicular access from Vernon Drive.
There will be two firefighting response points: Primary at 1725 Clark Dr, include access to floors below 3rd storey, and Secondary at 1775 Clark Dr, access to levels above 3rd storey only.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
STAGE CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued September 13, 2022
Stage 1 Revision 1 - Reduction in extent of cut-off wall following additional ground water seepage analysis on site - issued August 2, 2023
Stage 2 - Full Construction - issued September 8, 2023

applicant: Matt Turco DBA: GHL Consultants Ltd.
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a six-storey building, combustible construction, containing a total of 102 social housing dwelling units, all over one level of underground parking providing 27 parking spaces having vehicular access from the lane.
Principal entrance on McHardy St. Street extension must be completed prior to building occupancy.
Roof assemblies, R1 and R2 as shown on arch drawings, joist channels to be partitioned into volumes each not exceeding 160 cubic feet using 1/2" Type X GWB and firestopping where required at penetrations, as required per NFPA 13 and to be confirmed on site.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511). Energy conforms to 10.2.2.5. Passive House. Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued August 8, 2022
Stage 1 Revision 1 - Revised shoring drawings to include:
- Shoring adjacent to tree protection area along west elevation,
- temporary support and shoring of power pole along north elevation, and
- additional shoring to facilitate fire pump tank installation along west elevation, per AL-2022-00141 - issued October 27, 2022.
Stage 2 - Full Construction - issued November 23, 2022

applicant: David Steer DBA: LMDG Building Code Consultants Ltd.
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 9-storey mixed-use building with office and laboratory use all over four (4) levels of underground parking having vehicular access from the rear lane.
The new building is designed to provide a highly flexible lab capable building with the potential to have up to 70% lab and up to 30% office/support space located anywhere in the building. The flexibility will respond to changing needs to the occupants for changes in science programs, personnel requirements, operational changes, changing equipment and growth/reduction of space needs.
Stage I: Excavation/shoring issued July 27/ 22.
Stage II: Full BP issued February 22/23.(tn for mv)
Revision #1:Change of occupancy uses on Levels 2, 8 & 9 from Lab/office to office.

description:

2 - Add pull stations at exit doors in fence.

applicant: Kai Mikkelsen DBA: Thorson Consulting CP
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a new 5 storey mixed-use building containing:
- Level 1 - future 8 CRUs shell ( Group E)
- Level 2 to 5 - 91 residential strata units
- Level 6 - open space amenity area, incl. children's play area;
The building is demised into 2 separate buildings on top of a 2-level common underground 3.2.1.2. parkade. The above grade building/s are constructed in accordance with construction requirements of Articles 3.2.2.50 & 3.2.2.58.
Note: combustible soffits are proposed at all exterior balconies.
Note: Main entrance and FD access to the 2-level residential units ( #201 to #207) is from residential lobby at 2471 St. George St. Signage and map to be posted at conspicuous location in the residential lobby close to elevators and FACP.
This building is equipped with Radio Antenna System.
This project was reviewed under the VBBL 2019.
11-July-2022 - Stage I (excavation and shoring) issued.
01-Dec -2023 - Stage II (full permit) issued.

applicant: Jeff Mitchell DBA: GHL Consultants Ltd.
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - This permit has been issued for all site work and below grade facilities including four levels of common underground parking for the proposed development:
To construct two mixed-use towers above a common parking podium. The podium slab will be designed as 3.2.1.2. slab.
West Building: A 11-storey mixed-use building consisting
1st to 3rd storeys - light industrial use (shell)
4th to 11th storeys - office use (shell)
East Building: A 13-storey mixed-use building consisting
1st storey with mezzanine - industrial flex units (shell)
2nd to 13th storeys - 216 secured market rental dwelling units including ten 2-level units on the 12th storey. Access to 13th storey can be via unit interior stairs and exit stair shafts, but not by elevators,
all over 4 levels of common underground parking having access from the lane.
Refer to
BP-2021-01870 for [220 E 1st Ave] (West Building)
BP-2021-01871 for [1717 Lorne St] (East Building)
CACF will be provided at the principal entrance at each above grade building.
Separate tenant improvement permits are required for all shell tenant spaces.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2014 Vancouver Building By-law (#10908).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued June 27, 2022
Stage 1 Revision 1 - Revised shoring to improve structural support of the shoring walls on west side of site - issued September 20, 2022
Stage 2 - Foundation to Grade - issued November 8, 2022
Stage 3 - Full Construction - issued May 1, 2023

Issued: January 24, 2023

applicant: Kenneth Kim DBA: Kenneth Kim Architecture Inc.
description:
High Density Housing / Commercial - New Building - Building Permit for DP-2019-00184 & Minor Amendment DP-2020-00632
To construct a three-storey multi-dwelling building containing 3 dwelling units ($1,459,600), over 1 level of underground parking providing a total of 3 parking spaces having vehicular access from W 7th Avenue.
Building envelope and environmental separation as per Part 5 design:
Schedule A, Kenneth Kim, AIBC (778.379.8908);
Schedule B (Architectural) Kenneth Kim, AIBC (778.379.8908);
Schedule B (Structural), Min Park, P.Eng (778.836.7221);
Schedule B (Geotechnical), Joseph (Inseok) Oh, P.Eng (604.513.4190) and
Schedule D (Commitment for Building Envelope Professional Review), Julio Reynel-Gracia, P.Eng (778.998.0709) provide for this project.
Building Review Branch Notes:
1. Three-unit multi-dwelling building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13R
2. Structural has been designed to Part 4
3. SP-2021-01084
4. This permit has been reviewed under the requirements of the VBBL #12511 (2019)
REV #1 (2023.04.03)
- Change 2373 W 7th Units third floor use from "Den" to "Storage"
REV #2 (June 01, 2023)
1. Change 2377 W 7th (Rear Unit) third attic floor insulation from Batt insulation to Spray foam insulation of same R-value. Not in Fire Rated Assembly.
2. Fire hydrant more than 90m, a private hose valve is proposed to provide water for sprinkler system, (Engineering Letter of Professional Judgement provided and accepted)

applicant: Michael Van Blokland DBA: LMDG Building Code Consultant
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a mixed-use building with 36 storeys (35 storeys plus rooftop amenity level) consisting of
1st storey - CRUs (shell only).
2nd to 35th storeys - 350 secured market rental housing units and 10 secured below-market rental housing units
36th storey - rooftop amenity space,
all over 4 levels of underground parking having vehicular access from the lane.
Separate tenant improvement permits required for all tenant spaces.
Total number of dwelling units = 360.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
STAGE CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued March 15, 2022
>>Stage 1 is issued in advance of DP. No work shall be commenced under this BP until the work and obligations under the other permits are completed, including any City or Provincial requirements.
Stage 1 Rev #1 - Revised excavation and shoring drawings include:
- revision to excavation depth,
- addition of vertical beams along SW shoring wall,
- revision of NW and SE shoring wall to accommodate removal of existing foundation wall,
- addition of shotcrete pilasters. - issued December 16, 2022
Stage 2 - Foundation to Grade - issued Dec. 20, 2022
Stage 3 - Full Construction - issued June 30, 2023

description:

applicant: John Buscemi, P.Eng.,C.P. DBA: GHL Consultants Ltd
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - This permit has been issued for all site work and below grade facilities including one level of common underground parking for the proposed development:
To construct a 6-storey mixed use building consisting of two Buildings (North and South Building) containing
Level 1 - Storage Warehouse (shell only) with mezzanine,
Levels 2 and 3 - Wholesale Class A use (shell only),
Level 4 - Textile Manufacturing Use (shell only), and
Levels 5 and 6 - General office Use (shell only),
all over a single level of underground parking and at grade parking all having vehicular access from the Manitoba Street. Underground parking entrance to be accessed from the North Building.
Refer to BP-2021-04763 for North Building - 8188 Manitoba St.
Refer to BP-2021-04765 for South Building - 8250 Manitoba St.
Separate tenant improvement permits are required for all tenant spaces.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
The office shell portions of the building are TIPs eligible at the time of construction.
Staged Construction
Stage 1 - Excavation and Foundation to Grade, including site densification - issued March 4, 2022
Stage 2 - Full Construction - issued July 13, 2022
Revision 1 - Addition of commercial kitchen exhaust shaft to both Buildings 1 and 2 - in review

applicant: Heather Johnston DBA: PLACE architect ltd.
description:
High Density Housing / Commercial - New Building - ***PART 5***
To construct a new 3-storey multiple dwelling containing five (5) dwelling unit with three (3) surface parking spaces at the rear of the site with vehicular access from the lane.
Note:
1. The building is a two-and-a-half (2.5) storey plus basement per the development permit.
2. All 5 dwelling units have direct exterior entrance.
Revision-1 February 25, 2022
Updated the landscaping drawing
Revision-2 October 4, 2022
1- Revised roof assembly components
2- Conglomerate some adjacent windows
3- Replaced fire listed windows with standard windows protected with sprinkler water curtain per VBBL 3.2.3.13.(5)
4. Some windows are removed
5. Front entrance doors doors of unit 1 and unit 2 is modified
6- Fire department connection is relocated
7. Some interior bypass closet doors are replaced with swing type doors
8. layout of kitchens in unit 1 and unit 2 is modified
9. attic access hatches are identified on the drawings
10. Skylights added
11. Some interior wall types were modified and new roof assembly added

applicant: David Steer DBA: LMDG Building Code Consultants Ltd.
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a new 11-storey, mixed-use building consisting of:
1st, 2nd & 3rd storeys - Elementary School with Kindergarden at the 2nd storey;
4th storey - 65 space Childcare Facility with:
0-to 5 & 3 to 5 age groups,
5th to 11 storey - 60 Affordable non-market residential units.
The residential bike storages and storage rooms will be located in the basement. The building is constructed adjacent to the existing Coal Harbour Community Centre and will complete the Phase II of the Coal Harbour Community Mixed-Use Development proposed in 1997.
Phase I (Coal Harbour Community Centre) and
Phase II (New 11-storey, Mixed Use Building). Buildings will be constructed as separate buildings from VBBL standpoint, but both buildings will interconnect at basement and first storey levels and will share some facilities, such as parking garage and exit stair.
STAGE I - Excavation, Shoring & Soil Mix Panels -
Issued: Feb. 16, 2022.
STAGE II - Foundation to Grade, Structural only
Issued: Sept. 2, 2022.
STAGE III - Full Structure
Issued: Jan. 13, 2023.
STAGE IV - Full Permit
Issued: Jan 20, 2023.
NOTE: The separation between two buildings (Phase I and Phase II) and related VBBL requirements have been addressed on an Alternative Solution bases;
Refer to AL-2021-00161- Revised.
REVISIONS:
REV. #1 - Revised Ground Improvement approach.
Issued: May 5, 2022.
REV. #2 - Changes of Geotechnical Engineers of Record effective July 20, 2023.
Issued: 19-Oct-2023
REV#3 - 22-Mar-2024 -Change of Architect of Record and CRP.
Effective January 1, 2024 Gregory Henriquez, Architect AIBC assumed responsibility of Architect of Record and CRP for the design changes during construction of the Coal Harbour Phase I project at 488 Broughton St.

and 11 above-grade levels:
(Hospital Departments and series such as Emergency, Renal Health, Surgery, Mental Health, Maternity, Medical Imaging and Laboratory).

applicant: Matt Turco DBA: GHL Consultants Ltd.
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To raise the grade to achieve 4.6 m. flood construction level and to construct a new noncombustible industrial building (Building 1 - North) containing 11 two-level industrial strata units (shell).
Three industrial building are proposed on this site (Building 1, Building 2 and Building 3). Total number of warehouse shell units on this site is 25.
NOTE - all units will be provided with universal washroom at the TI application stage.
Related to BP-2021-03085 (Building 2) and
BP-2021-03086 (Building 3).
Each suite in Building 1 - North contains 2 levels:
1st Leve l- warehouse and office space (shell)
2nd Level- ancillary office (shell)
NOTE: It is PROHIBITTED to divide the 2-storey warehouse units with ancillary office at Level 2 into two suites up and down, because the second floor is not accessible.
The upper storey is permitted to contain only facilities that are also contained on the accessible storey; therefore, an office space at Level 1 shall be provided; refer to 3.8.2.1.(1) (f).
Letter of Commitment by the owner is on file.
All fees for the entire development on this site applied against this permit. This BP application was processed under the VBBL 2019.
Note: All plans and documents for the entire development ( Bldg 1, Bldg 2 & Bldg 3) on this site were uploaded under the main permit - BP-2021-01262.
09-Feb-2022 - Stage I (on Site Grading) issued.
13-May-2022 - Stage II (Full Permit) issued.
23-Mar-2023 ; BP Revision #1 issued.
Changes to Buildings 2 and 3 only.
Project description updated to reflect reduced number of units in Building 3.
Refer to BP-2021-03085 (Building 2) & BP-2021-03086 (Building 3) for detailed description of changes.

High Density Housing / Commercial - New Building - To construct a three-storey two-family dwelling with two secondary suites (Building 1) at the front of the site and to construct a two-storey one-family dwelling with attached two-car garage (Building 2) and one surface parking space at the rear of the site with vehicular access from the lane.

applicant: Naki Ocran
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - Construction of new 4 storey building high-rise building (Group B-3) with 95 rental sleeping units, for purposes of assisted living and memory care with ancillary amenity and support facilities, all over one level of underground parking.
11-Jan-2022 - Stage 1- excavation, foundation to grade(A/S/M/E) issued.
19-Apr-2022 - Stage 2 - full construction issued.
Notes:
This Permit was issued under the VBBL 2019 and during the COVID 19 pandemic.
Class-1 and Class-5 cooking operations.
03-Feb-2022 - Revision#1 issued.
Revised Excavation & Shoring drawings, encroachment in property to the North in proposed.

Change of CP.

18-Aug-2023 - Revision #3 issued.
1. Deletion of Wood Ceilings at L1 / replaced with gypsum
2. Code report and CCD updated per City comments regarding standpipe hose connections and
associated signage.
3. Code report and CCD updated to capture updates to fire separations and interior finish
requirements.
